isis.stitle: BRAKE COMPONENTS: This Service Manual Section should be used for reference only. For more current service information on all components go to the Bendix website from the ISIS Suppliers menu and refer to the Service Data Sheets. - QR-N QUICK RELEASE VALVE

svcproc.title: DESCRIPTION
svcproc.para: The function of the Quick Release Valve is to "speed up" the exhaust of air from the brake chambers. It is generally mounted on the vehicle axle midway between the two brake chambers connected to it.

In the standard QR-N ( Figure 27 ), a flat circular diaphragm is installed between the non-metallic upper body and stamped steel lower body. An O-ring seals the two body halves, which are held together with four 1/4" machine screws and flange nuts. The steel lower body also serves as the valve mounting bracket. In its standard configuration ( Figure 28 ), the QR-N is supplied with a 1 psi maximum differential.

figure.caption: Figure 28. QR-N Quick Release Valve - Cross Section

svcproc.para: A higher differential pressure valve (3 psi) is available for special applications. The higher differential pressure is obtained by the addition of a spring and diaphragm follower to the standard QR-N. Refer to Figure 29 .

figure.caption: Figure 29. Addition of a Spring and Diaphragm

svcproc.para: The difference between a standard QR-N or differential QR-N valve can be determined by following one or more of the steps listed below:

step1.para: Scrape paint from the valve surface. If the color of the plastic is gray, it is a differential valve.
Remove the fitting from the outlet port. If there is a spring inside the port, it is a differential valve.
Remove the valve from the crossmember. The part number tag on the cross- member side of the valve lists the valve operating pressure.
